alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 12:03PM EDT until April 14 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River from Elliston to Hazleton. .Lowland, minor flooding continues along the middle and lower Wabash River, and rainfall amounts of one to over two inches yesterday brought renewed flooding or will prolong flooding along the lower White River and at Seymour on the East Fork White. Minor flooding on the East Fork White at Seymour will last into the weekend and could develop at other points on the lower East Fork White. Minor flooding on the lower White and lower Wabash will last through much of next week. Minor flooding primarily impacts local river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Mainly dry conditions are expected for the next several days, which will allow time for rivers to crest and fall below flood for the lowest portions of the White and Wabash by next weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY, APRIL 14... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Friday, April 14. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flooding affects higher bottomlands and may affect a few residents in an area known as Dodge City. Local roads leading to Dodge City area are flooded. State Road 257 south of Washington completely floods at this level if Shoals remains above 16 feet. Ditch Road begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EDT Thursday /9:45 AM CDT Thursday/ the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:45 AM EDT Thursday /9:45 AM CDT Thursday/ was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 21.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday, April 14. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
